rdfs:label: Anatomical-landmark
dc:description: A collection of specific points on the human body used for anatomical and sensor placement reference.
Annotations: dc:source "Original", rdfs:comment "Body landmarks are used to standardize sensor placement.

rdfs:label: Head-landmark
dc:description: Points on the head used as reference landmarks.

rdfs:label: Nasion
dc:description: The midpoint between the eyes just above the bridge of the nose.

rdfs:label: Inion
dc:description: The most prominent point of the occipital bone at the back of the head.

rdfs:label: Left-helix-tragus-junction-LHJ
dc:description: The point where the helix meets the tragus of the left ear.

rdfs:label: Right-helix-tragus-junction-RHJ
dc:description: The point where the helix meets the tragus of the right ear.

rdfs:label: Vertex
dc:description: The highest point on the head in the midline.

rdfs:label: Torso-chest-landmark
dc:description: Points on the chest used as reference landmarks.

rdfs:label: Acromion-process
dc:description: The outermost point of the shoulder blade.

rdfs:label: Vertebra-prominens-C7
dc:description: The seventh cervical vertebra at the base of the neck.

rdfs:label: Xiphoid-process
dc:description: The small cartilaginous process at the lower end of the sternum.
